page.title: 05School Parents Assocn Henham
page.content: The Parents Association was started by Mr Griffiths in October 1973 when some parents asked if a Parents Association could be formed.Every parent who has a child at the school is automatically a member of it.The chairman in 1985 is Mrs Redfern.The money raised at different functions is spent on the pupils and their needs.The most recent things to be bought were some floppy discs for the computer.In 1984 Â£1,500 was raised and it is hoped that amount will be raised in 1985.There are at least six meetings in a year.The preident is Mr Griffiths,the headmaster.The object of the Parent Assocation is to advance the education of the pupils in the school,by providing facilities for education. Some things the assocation have provided are 2 computers,television, sports kit,maths and visual aids.
